author: tersec
content:
Both `invalid_source_signature` and `invalid_target_signature` consolidation operations tests for both `minimal` and `mainnet` appear to have a
```
get_consolidation_churn_limit(state) =
  get_balance_churn_limit(state) - get_activation_exit_churn_limit(state) = 
  get_balance_churn_limit(state) - min(MAX_PER_EPOCH_ACTIVATION_EXIT_CHURN_LIMIT, get_balance_churn_limit(state)) = 
  0
```
because the `get_balance_churn_limit(state)` isn't high enough. This means that they fail not because of invalid signatures, per https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/v1.5.0-alpha.0/specs/electra/beacon-chain.md#consolidations but because of other reasons, and it also means the `invalid_source_signature` and `invalid_target_signature` consolidation operations tests don't meaningfully test signature checking
